string_replace_all: You can use this function to parse a string looking for specific parts, which can then be replaced by the new string that you have specified in all places that they occur.
The substring within the string to be replaced in all instances.
The new substring to replace the previous one(s).
This will set <tt>str2</tt> to <tt>str1</tt>, but with its instances of "x" replaced with "l", resulting in <tt>str2</tt> being "Hello World".
